History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has been experiencing anxiety and paranoia, which led to a recent diagnosis of PTSD. They sought help due to mental issues that were new to them, including feelings of paranoia and anxiety. They have been practicing yoga and meditation, which has helped improve their perspective, but they still struggle with triggers related to their past experiences.
Medical and Psychiatric History: The patient was diagnosed with PTSD a few months ago.
Psychosocial History: The patient is originally from Pennsylvania and moved to LA for a better quality of life. They have a close relationship with their family and have supportive friends and a boyfriend who help them cope with their anxiety. They studied advertising communications but are currently not working.
Mental Health Observations: The patient reports feeling foggy and low when they do not sleep well, but they are generally good at controlling their temper.
Physiological Observations: The patient has experienced improvements in sleep, now able to sleep through the night after initial difficulties.
Current Functional Status: The patient has two good friends and a supportive boyfriend, which aids their adjustment to life in LA. They are gradually increasing their time outside and practicing deep breathing exercises to manage anxiety.
Diagnostic Impressions: The patient is diagnosed with PTSD and is experiencing anxiety and paranoia.
Progress Evaluation: The patient feels more like themselves and is more cautious about their thoughts and decisions, indicating progress in therapy.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is currently attending therapy and has found it beneficial for their self-reflection and journaling.
